intro: Courtoisia daucifolia, commonly known as the Persian parsley or Persian cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features slender, branched stems and finely divided, feather-like leaves that resemble those of parsley. Its flowers are small, white or pale yellow, and arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Courtoisia daucifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can thrive in well-drained soils with full sun.
